summary: Over the 6‑hour window winds were consistently high (mean ~18 m/s, SD ~1 m/s) with strong gusts up to ~34 m/s, yet active power remained extremely steady around 0.976 with minimal variability. Rotor speed was essentially constant while generator speed showed modest variation; blade pitch averaged about 14.8° and the nacelle was persistently offset from the wind by roughly 8.1°. Average production was roughly 0.11 units below expected and temperatures averaged about 67°C — notable operational observations are the near‑constant rotor speed, sustained yaw offset, consistent pitch setting, and the presence of high gusts.
